actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to H. Res. 240. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on March 25, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Stanton moved that the House do now adjourn.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 240 — "Expressing the profound sorrow of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Raúl M. Grijalva."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution, as amended Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the Steil amendment; Agreed to without objection.
An amendment, in the nature of a substitute offered by Mr. Steil, Amendment is the reported version of the resolution, House Report 119-17 as reported by the Committee on House Administration.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 198 — "Providing for the expenses of certain committees of the House of Representatives in the One Hundred Nineteenth Congress."
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification of the designation as emergency requirements 16 appropriations (including the transfer and repurposing of funds) so designated by Congress in the Act pursuant to section 251(b)(2)(A) of BBEDCA, as outlined in the enclosed list of accounts
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Appropriations and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 119-31).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 372
actions-list.actionItem: 35 (Roll no. 73).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1326 — "To provide for Department of Energy and Department of Agriculture joint research and development activities, and for other purposes."
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the Honorable Raul M. Grijalva.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 405
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 72).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 359 — "To amend the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to require reporting relating to certain cost-share requirements, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 24.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 6:30 P.M. today.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1534.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Babin moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1534 — "To strengthen and enhance the competitiveness of American industry through the research and development of advanced technologies to improve the efficiency of cement, concrete, and asphalt production, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1368.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Babin moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1368 — "To provide for Department of Energy and National Aeronautics and Space Administration research and development coordination, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1350.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Babin moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1350 — "To provide for Department of Energy and National Science Foundation research and development coordination, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1326.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Babin moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1326 — "To provide for Department of Energy and Department of Agriculture joint research and development activities, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1325.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Babin moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1325 — "To provide for transparent licensing of commercial remote sensing systems, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1318.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Babin moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1318 — "To amend the Research and Development, Competition, and Innovation Act to clarify the definition of foreign country for purposes of malign foreign talent recruitment restriction, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 730.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Babin moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 730 — "To coordinate Federal research and development efforts focused on modernizing mathematics in STEM education through mathematical and statistical modeling, including data-driven and computational thinking, problem, project, and performance-based learning and assessment, interdisciplinary exploration, and career connections, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 359.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Babin moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 359 — "To amend the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to require reporting relating to certain cost-share requirements, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Ms. Foxx to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 24.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Abraham J. Hamadeh to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
